body: adds new `pack` command. Pack creates a `Dist` dir in your project with the games saved in a zip and tar files.

Adds support for `--editor VERSION` to be passed when either opening a project or building it.

Additionally updates the copyright to 2026 and does some doc fixes

Fix working with AGS 4.0.0.20 projects, it crashed due to being unable to find VersionIndex, which was removed in https://github.com/adventuregamestudio/ags/commit/ca79f81c560e5e8899e1633699c08ac1538a0f6d, but since we only rely in EditorVersion, we can just drop reading VersionIndex.

We also bumped the requests package to version 2.32.4.

Additionally minor help text improvements were made.
added `--timeout` option that can be passed when either exporting a template using the editor or building a game using the editor.
better idea on typeerror problem when listing releases from github api
supports using`/maketemplate` command from the editor from atbx, using `--force-editor` parameter
fix not finding already installed 3.6.2 AGS Editor
fix type issue that crashes atbx

Experimental Template export

```
atbx export template ../ags-template-source/Tumbleweed Tumbleweed.agt .
```
Better logging in case can't find AGS Game project (`Game.agf` files)
Fixes finding GitHub Releases of AGS4
fix agstoolbox can't find release candidate

Adds `export` command, which lets you export script modules from game projects!

```
$ ./atbx.exe export --help
usage: atbx export [-h] {script} ...

optional arguments:
  -h, --help  show this help message and exit

sub_export:
  {script}
    script    export script module from project
```

```
./atbx.exe export script --help
usage: atbx export script [-h] PROJECT_PATH MODULE_NAME OUT_DIR

positional arguments:
  PROJECT_PATH  path to the project with the module
  MODULE_NAME   name of the script module
  OUT_DIR       where to export the script module

optional arguments:
  -h, --help    show this help message and exit
```

You can use it like 

```
./atbx.exe export script my_game my_module .
```
atbx redirects output from AGS Editor running in command line internally

when using `atbx open project PROJECT_PATH`, it adds the following flag

```
-w, --which-editor  give editor path only, don't open project
```

This makes it instead return the editor path, so it can be stored in a variable and be used later
Fix issue where downloading progress bar can crash a terminal for updating too quickly
Fix longstanding issue that agstoolbox could not execute ags editor and have it build for windows due to error patching the exe info!
Fixes can't download recent ags versions

- add a search bar

![agstoolbox_search](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2244442/232314037-d3f30d0b-2cbc-427c-9e62-005046b9f76f.gif)
- allow quieting the download bar and using blocking and non-blocking command line operations
fix installation of editor version from project version failure

- fix Building with editor could fail when working directory wasn't the editor directory
- the project path is the absolute path
- report required editor on failure
- adds the project build command in atbx and a quick project build in agstoolbox
fixes missing metadata in .exe binaries
fixes PyPI release

- command line utility atbx.exe had no metadata
- fix some direct project paths were not working in atbx
- minor cosmetic adjustments in command line
Adds companion atbx executable
available on pypi

- less unused blank space at left in the tools and projects lists
- a placeholder expand and collapse button
- right click on a download can open the original GitHub release page
- lots of refactor in settings, functionality is kept,

name: 0.2.2: less inconsistent settings
body: reduces chances invalid settings are written or read

name: 0.2.1: bug fix!
body: enhance AGS GitHub Releases compatibility, 3.6.0 Release uses a different naming scheme, should recognize at least 5 more releases I missed last time

- running it a second time raises the AGS Toolbox window instead of opening a second instance
- place the executable in a suitable place and you can register it to boot on startup

name: 0.1.3: fix no patch tag parse failure
body: fix failures on 3.4.3 version
